source.document_id: Community hospital experience using ENB integrating tidal volume computed tomography mapping

metadata.title: Community hospital experience using electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy system integrating tidal volume computed tomography mapping

sections.abstract: Results of the first 50 consecutive patients referred for bronchoscopy or surgery by the tumor review board to confirm suspect lung lesions identified by computed tomography. Electromagnetic navigation was used to biopsy peripheral pulmonary nodules (19.3 ± 10.7 mm). An electromagnetic tracking system detected miniature position sensors integrated into tip-tracked instruments advanced through a 2 mm working channel in a bronchoscope. Learning curve, diagnostic yield, safety, and use of 4D positional information on the patient’s tidal volume expiration CT map demonstrate potential to improve the diagnostic yield of transbronchial biopsies of peripheral pulmonary nodules less than 30 mm, reporting a diagnostic yield of 83.3% (40/48). Early experience was safe and effective, with a limited learning curve.
sections.methods: Study design: retrospective chart review of the first 50 consecutive patients (61 lesions) referred by a multidisciplinary hospital tumor review board for diagnostic follow-up of suspect lung lesions on CT. Patients were treated July 2012-May 2013 at a community hospital. Procedures: tidal volume expiration (TV-EXP)-mapped electromagnetic navigation (EMN) bronchoscopy using the SPiNDrive System (Veran Medical Technologies, USA). Flexible bronchoscopy confirmed a clear airway; conscious sedation was used. Linear-EBUS was available as needed. Radial-EBUS, fluoroscopic navigation, and ROSE were not used. Data collected included procedure experience, diagnostic test reports, and follow-up over 24 months. Final diagnosis determined by repeat CT, TTNA, or surgical resection/biopsy as clinically indicated.
sections.results: Fifty patients (28 males, 22 females; age 31-87 years, mean 67.7 ± 12.2) had 61 lesions biopsied. Mean lesion size was 19.3 ± 10.7 mm (range 4-49 mm). For peripheral pulmonary nodules <30 mm, diagnostic yield was 83.3% (40/48). Early experience was reported as safe and effective with a limited learning curve.

population.text: Adults with suspect lung lesions on CT referred by a multidisciplinary tumor review board at a community hospital for diagnostic biopsy.
inclusion_criteria: Positive chest CT with suspect lung lesion
Referred by tumor review board for biopsy or surgery
Able to undergo bronchoscopy with conscious sedation

intervention.text: Tidal volume expiration (TV-EXP)-mapped electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (EMN)
intervention.details: SPiNDrive EMN system with respiratory-gated CT mapping; EM tip-tracked instruments advanced through a 2 mm bronchoscope working channel; endobronchial access with linear-EBUS as needed; no radial-EBUS, fluoroscopic navigation, or ROSE.

comparison.details: No concurrent control; historical context includes TTNA and TLC-mapped ENB from literature.

outcomes.name: Diagnostic yield for peripheral pulmonary nodules <30 mm

analysis_populations.name: All patients
analysis_populations.description: All consecutive patients undergoing TV-EXP EMN bronchoscopy

analysis_populations.name: Lesions <30 mm
analysis_populations.description: Peripheral pulmonary nodules <30 mm assessed for diagnostic yield

outcomes_normalized.name: Diagnostic yield for peripheral pulmonary nodules <30 mm

domains.name: Confounding
domains.support_for_judgment: Single-arm retrospective case series without control; potential selection and verification bias.

domains.name: Selection of participants
domains.support_for_judgment: First 50 consecutive patients referred by tumor board may reduce but not eliminate selection bias.

domains.name: Classification of interventions
domains.support_for_judgment: All patients received the same EMN procedure.

domains.name: Deviations from intended interventions
domains.support_for_judgment: No deviations reported; protocol clearly described.

domains.name: Missing data
domains.support_for_judgment: All 50 patients completed procedures; follow-up planned to 24 months.

domains.name: Measurement of outcomes
domains.support_for_judgment: Diagnostic yield determined by pathology/clinical follow-up; lack of blinding may influence classification.

domains.name: Selection of reported result
domains.support_for_judgment: Primary yield reported; limited detail on safety outcomes in available text.

retrieval.summary_tldr: Single-center case series: TV-EXP EMN achieved diagnostic yield 83.3% (40/48) for peripheral pulmonary nodules <30 mm.
retrieval.clinical_relevance: Supports minimally invasive diagnosis of small peripheral lung nodules in a community setting with high yield.
